intro: Ptychogyne, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. These plants are native to various regions in Africa and are characterized by their showy, yellow or orange flowers. Ptychogyne species typically have compound leaves and produce legume-like pods that contain seeds. They are often found in grassy habitats and are adapted to seasonal rainfall patterns. The genus is of interest in botany due to its ecological roles and potential medicinal properties.
